rev.comment: /* Operating Thetan levels and the Xenu incident */
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/202.81.18.30|202.81.18.30]] ([[User talk:202.81.18.30|talk]]) to last version by Terryeo
redid the introduction. It has a ritual or two, it states a belief or two, but it is about knowledge, as its title states.
/* The Church of Scientology */ Removed Abbr. We're not 5 years old
/* Celebrity practitioners */ added a link to celebrity success statements
whole government didn't make sense to me.
/* Critical sites */ style changes...made list cleaner and more neutral.
/* Past lives */ minor change to citation.
/* Past lives */ reworded with proper citation indicating that Leiby is the one saying "Former scientologists". Previously looked like a weasel word.
rv edits by Dcottle561 which argue on behalf of Scientology in a very POV way
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/80.47.43.102|80.47.43.102]] ([[User talk:80.47.43.102|talk]]) to last version by 86.131.7.72
/* Tax-exempt status and status as a religion */

rv Please use {{fact}} tags and Talk page
Can these statements be supported? The assertions seem very biased.

corrected a verb tense, "is" to "was", it having happened in 1953
/* Tax-exempt status and status as a religion */

rev.user: Can't sleep, clown will eat me
rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/66.60.208.139|66.60.208.139]] ([[User talk:66.60.208.139|talk]]) to last version by Chcknwnm
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/80.47.185.206|80.47.185.206]] to last version by Jahiegel
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/80.47.89.176|80.47.89.176]] to last version by 72.136.249.203
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/80.47.76.201|80.47.76.201]] ([[User talk:80.47.76.201|talk]]) to last version by Vivaldi
added one more reference from CoS. This one says Scientology is "study of truth"... who knew?
/* Silent birth and infant care */ man this is hard to do without using Scientologese language.
/* Official status as a religion */ rearranged and reworded. Added citations to what may have been disputed claims.
/* Silent Birth and Infant Care */ clarified what a quoted pronoun was referring to.
/* Silent Birth and Infant Care */ shortened this section a bit. Too long for an article about scientology and it was biased.
/* Quiet Birth and Infant Care */ should be "silent birth". Also added a reference to show that "many doctors" do disagree with Hubbard.
/* Celebrity practitioners */ Properly sourced the claim about celebrity scientologists. Removed link to "The Fable" which states in its own text that it is IN FACT an anonymous FABLE.
/* Isaac Hayes and ''South Park'' */ fixed citation.
/* Official status as a religion */ Added proper citatation. I also removed a biased and factually incorrect statement. Other cleanup.
/* Scientology and other religions */ again..."critics maintain..." but no reference to back it up. Which critics are we talking about? When and where did they "maintain" these claims?
/* Scientology and other religions */ lots more "critics claim..." but no sources. These are weasel words. We need to specify which critics said what (or cite 2nd source that says "critics claim.."
/* Operating Thetan levels and the Xenu incident */ "Critics point out..." are [[WP:WEASEL|weasel words]]. Which critics point it out, when, and where? Cite sources please.
/* Operating Thetan levels and the Xenu incident */ "Journalists and critics counter" are [[WP:WEASEL|weasel words]]. Specify which cirtics said what, when, and where.
rv to last by {{user2|Geedubber}}. I wasn't impressed with these undiscussed changes. Please use the talk page and explain your edits with the edit summaries.
/* Operating Thetan levels and the Xenu incident */
revert to Revision as of 13:22, April 13, 2006

rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/63.138.179.58|63.138.179.58]] ([[User talk:63.138.179.58|talk]]) to last version by Hoopydink
Removed 2000s fads category - have posted concerns on talk page... will adhere to the 3RR
RV - Fads need not be a PAST phenomenon. If anyone wants to take up the issue of faddism, please take it to the talk page. I don't want a revert war here.
calling a person's religion a "fad" is a bit callous and a fad is something that has already faded away, while scientology, at least in pop culture, is still very much visible
RV - regardless of when it was founded, it became a fad of the 2000s
removed '''2000s fads''' category, as scientology was founded in 1953
